website_summaries.verdict: For those who suffer from arthritis or other issues affecting grip or arm strength, this masher is an ideal alternative to traditional models with vertical handles.
pros: Uses wide horizontal handle for better ergonomics
Works equally well with other mashable fruits and vegetables, such as berries and avocados
cons: Handle can disconnect from base or break under pressure
Edges are sharp, can damage bowl
Smaller holes behave more like a ricer

customer_reviews.title: A great kitchen tool!
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the BEST potato masher ever invented. The horizontal handle gives good control, it's comfortable to use, and the business end produces 5# of smooth mashed potatoes or applesauce faster than a food mill. Simple and perfect. If you regularly mash vegetables or fruit, especially in large quantities, this is the gadget you need. [NOT a paid review; I bought this item and I'm very happy with it.]
customer_reviews.author: evl

customer_reviews.title: One of the things I like best about this particular version is the stainless steel ...
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this to the standard / typical Potato Masher. One of the things I like best about this particular version is the stainless steel is one solid piece with no welding spot. This makes clean up easy and I don't have to worry about any food particle hiding in crevasse.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Haston

customer_reviews.title: I love this potato masher
customer_reviews.text: I love this potato masher! It is easy to grip the bar across the top, and the holes are just right for getting almost all the lumps out (we actually prefer having a few small lumps left). When I use an electric mixer, my potatoes seem to become gummy; and I found that there is actual science for which involves the starch in the potatoes. Easy to store, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: JeanneLai

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Love it. Love it. This has got to be the best masher I have ever used. Does a great job and very easy to use. I am tossing our old one (the squiggly wire type) as I don't even want it in the house as a back up. If anything happen to this one I will order another immediately
customer_reviews.author: RGB

customer_reviews.title: Works better than an old fashioned masher!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ergonomic handle and the stainless steel looks like it will hold up unlike my previous name brand plastic one. It snapped in two while mashing soft cooked potatoes!! The holes mash the potatoes with an appearance like a ricer which is great. I prefer mashed potatoes with body, even some chunkiness sometimes so I like it a lot. Small enough not to take up a lot of room in drawer but easy to find. It stands up!!
customer_reviews.author: MichiganStatefan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Have had this for a few months now and only used a few times, and the plastic handle came off. Poor quality
customer_reviews.author: Bill Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy. Doesn't Bend
customer_reviews.text: Leaving a review for a potato masher is kind of weird. But I must say, this is by far the best potato masher I've ever had it used. Most bend or give a little. This one is rock solid. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ken Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: Have used this to Nash bananas for bread, strawberries for jsm snd eggs for egg salad. It works great snd since I have arthritis in my hands sometimes these tasks are difficult and this makes it so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Farmer Girl

customer_reviews.title: To big and bulky
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to try it especially for the price but you get what you pay for . It's big and bulky , the edges aren't smooth they have bumps so it did cut my hand/fingers a few times. I say spend the extra money and get something better
customer_reviews.author: stephanie_liliana

customer_reviews.title: Mash On!
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable masher. The handle is comfortable. The construction is sturdy. It is very efficient when mashing. I made strawberry jam and it took less time to Nathan I expected. I store mine flat in a drawer without any issues. I look forward to many years of quality mashing since it is much easier to work with than my previous vertical-handle/grip one. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ginica

customer_reviews.title: I'm a fan
customer_reviews.text: I have only had this a short time, but it works great, seems well-built, and is comfortable to use. I feel that it's unlikely that anything will go wrong with this thing, unlike the many plastic options that are out there that break catastrophically with exactly the kind of force you'd use to perform the job its made for.
customer_reviews.author: Cory S

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable to use, until it comes apart
customer_reviews.text: The plastic handle came off the metal arms during the very first use. I had to finish mashing the potatoes by holding onto the arms to keep the handle in place. This surprised me because of the many good reviews. Maybe this just happened to be a defective one. I returned it and bought one with a different design because this failure revealed a weakness in the design.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and does the job of mashing spuds
customer_reviews.text: First time I have ever actually purchased a potato masher and I am so glad I did. It worked better then the radom ones I had accumulated over the years the eventually broke, making me curse potato mashers all together. I decided to give them one more chance. I don't see this one croaking on me any time soon! Lol
customer_reviews.author: lourie

customer_reviews.title: Mighty Masher
customer_reviews.text: Solid steel masher with well positioned handle and varied size holes in the paddle that make quick work of making mashed produce. Takes a strong arm to wield it to do the job though. We started with the wire masher to break down boiled potatoes then moved to this to finish the job to a smoother consistency.
customer_reviews.author: MommaBear

customer_reviews.title: Works well, great design
customer_reviews.text: Good quality potato masher that you can really drive down due to the design. Much better than traditional mashers that require you to hold them like a drumstick. This is also great for browning ground meats, far more efficient than using a spatula or spoon. I would buy again, recommended.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Neely

customer_reviews.title: Mash away!
customer_reviews.text: This masher is comfortable to use and mashes anything I have used it for ... potatoes, bananas and carrots. Easy to clean. My last masher broke at the weld on the bottom, this one doesn't have those weak places.
customer_reviews.author: GOLDENOLDIE

customer_reviews.title: Great product, so many uses!
customer_reviews.text: Our newly purchased potato masher is terrific! It is sturdy and does a great job of breaking up the pieces. I have also used it to make egg salad and also to mash pears for a sauce. Washes beautifully in the dishwasher...very happy customer! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: sandb365

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy and has a better design and handling then the ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't really mash the potatoes as well as the others. It is sturdy and has a better design and handling then the others but i believe the holes are too small.
customer_reviews.author: TEO

customer_reviews.title: holes don't work as well for mashing as does a swirly design.
customer_reviews.text: The holes on these don't work as well more mashing in my opinion so that it doesn't really mash potatoes is makes potato spaghetti instead. I have to use a second utensil to mash. Next time I buy a masher I'll stick with the swirly design. I do like the handle and stainless steel though.
customer_reviews.author: Frugal Gal

customer_reviews.title: chunky mash, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: this thing works like a charm. Mashed potatoes in a chunky form - and for those that want them smooth, just mush 'em again. Easy leverage - simple to clean (no edges to worry about).
customer_reviews.author: BirchGrove Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great For Getting Out All Lumps
customer_reviews.text: I love this potato masher. MY roommate already had a masher that had a wavy bottom, but I felt like it was not as effective as I wanted which is why I bought this masher. I like how it is a flat bottom, but still is very effective and quick at mashing lumps out of potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Easy to mash potatoes and more!
customer_reviews.text: This handle makes it so much easier to mash potatoes (and more) without your hand cramping up. Easy to clean, i put it on the top shelf of my dish-washer.
customer_reviews.author: Ariana Zarate

customer_reviews.title: This works really well for potatoes and getting a pretty smooth texture
customer_reviews.text: This works really well for potatoes and getting a pretty smooth texture. I had a hard time pushing down to make broccoli and cauliflower mash. It is advertised as a potato masher but I purchased to hopefully use for other veggies. Overall I'm happy, just need to put in a little extra effort for other veggies.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISTIE CAMPBELL

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Ergonomic Potato Masher
customer_reviews.text: Great design and does a nice job making creamy mashed potatoes with no lumps. I had thumb surgery, and it was painful to use a regualar masher. This one allowed me to mash potatoes without hurting my thumb because I can hold it in a position that doesn't hurt and traumatize my thumb.
customer_reviews.author: Deep Forest

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I've been using a plastic masher for years. I have gotten used to lumpy potatoes. After several uses I am extremely please with how great this is. It's easy to use and with the handle being sideways it's easier to put some weight into mashing than with an up and down handled masher.
customer_reviews.author: Erdrick

customer_reviews.title: Nowhere as good as a wire masher
customer_reviews.text: There are two main types, this one, and a wire version. The problem is that there is so much solid surface area, and the holes are so small, that mashing a potato is like using a frying pan to mash potatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Devil Dave & Allie

customer_reviews.title: Great ergonomic design
customer_reviews.text: This is a great potato masher. I have never understood the design of other manual mashers because it wasnt ergonomic and your wrist was twisted pushing straight down on a shaft. This allows you to really use it comfortably and get some force down into the pot.
customer_reviews.author: MartyJoe

customer_reviews.title: ... based on online reviews that said it was the best in terms of construction and functionality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this masher based on online reviews that said it was the best in terms of construction and functionality. They were not wrong. I used to mashed a lot of potatoes for an event and this thing does a fine job producing very smooth mashed potatoes. Happy mashing!
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Raul Molina

customer_reviews.title: I loved how easy and quickly I was able to mash ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved how easy and quickly I was able to mash potatoes. It is a very good product. I highly recommend this masher.
customer_reviews.author: B. Darnell

customer_reviews.title: Makes mashed potatoes very smooth!
customer_reviews.text: This was out first potato masher, but it works wonderful! We used it last night and had very smooth mashed potatoes!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Calderhead

customer_reviews.title: The one I had for years broke where the side ...
customer_reviews.text: The one I had for years broke where the side handles attached to the mashing surface. This one is made in one piece and looks very strong. I expect to use it for many years and pass it on to my grandchildren.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Love the quality and sturdiness of this masher. Will come in handy when I make neeps and tatties for Burn's Night...and any other time I crave mashed potatoes. Well worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Kpr

customer_reviews.title: It mashes potatoes and it cleans easily. The potato tends to come up through the ...
customer_reviews.text: It mashes potatoes and it cleans easily. The potato tends to come up through the little circles like playdough, which is a little weird, but just mash it until you have a bunch of circles and then mash the circles. Comes out fine in the end.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I would highly recommend this masher. It made quick work of the Yukon Golds I was mashing and it even helped break down the chunks of butter I had in the pot. Easy to use, doesn't require much arm strength. Very easy to clean and the grip is comfortable. I'm going to use this on beans next and I'm sure it will do an excellent job. To sum up, if you need a new potato/bean masher, buy this one. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J. Pfieffer

customer_reviews.title: Now useless. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Failed at its most basic task. First the edges came with burrs and it scratched my pot. Secondly, after only a few uses the handle separated from one of the stems. The stems do NOT go completely through the handle in one solid line, they are just pressure fit onto the plastic handle. Pulled up while mashing and voilà, masher came apart. Now useless. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: thedaisyflowers

customer_reviews.title: Works great, not flimsy.
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I expected, and does what it's supposed to. Very easy to clean. Comfortable handle. I'm happy with it.

customer_reviews.title: Not just for taters

customer_reviews.title: Good masher

customer_reviews.title: this is a unit that I enjoy using, and the result is mashed potatoes with ...

In contrast, this is a unit that I enjoy using, and the result is mashed potatoes with an interesting consistency that I prefer. Highly recommended.

It works so much better than the wavy wire masher that I inherited from my Mom years ago. The best feature is that the oval shape lets me get to the edge of the pot when mashing. I used to have to use a spoon to dig out the perimeter potatoes that tried to escape the masher. It seems really sturdy and well built.

product_meta.title: KUKPO Stainless Steel Potato Masher with Broad and Ergonomic Horizontal Handle – Fine-grid Mashing Plate for Smooth Mashed Potatoes, Vegetables and Fruits
product_meta.description:
Why The KUKPO Potato Masher? 

Potato mashing was such a daunting task in the past for everyone who had to use the highly inefficient vertical handled potato masher. It was a nightmare for those who were developing first stages of arthritis. Thanks to the newly designed innovative potato masher with horizontal grip and wide mashing plate, potato mashing is no more a tiresome kitchen activity. You can really put your muscle into the mashing without having to develop huge forearms holding onto it, which mashes potatoes in seconds saving both time and effort. 

Traditional potato mashers are rather based on application on pressure on potatoes to mash them -more pressure applied, more effective mashing of potatoes. 

KUKPO potato masher is aimed at convenience and effectiveness both where potato mashing can be done under gentle pressure without tiring yourself. 

It also saves potato from smashing while mashing it neatly. 

Thanks to the wide mashing plate, now you can mash potatoes avoiding potatoes from slipping around which doubles the work.
